text: Idoch Castle was a 14th-century castle about east of Turriff, Aberdeenshire Scotland, near Idoch Water, a tributary of the River Deveron.Coventry, Martin (2001). The Castles of Scotland. Musselburgh: Goblinshead. p. 209 The alternative name is ‘’’Little Idoch’’’. ==History== Idoch Castle is supposed to have been built during the 14th century. The last vestige of the foundations was removed in 1850, when a large quantity of human bones and ashes was discovered. ==Structure== There is no record of the castle's structure. ==References== Category:Castles in Aberdeenshire Category:Former castles in Scotland
title: Idoch Castle
